Charity donation app

Product Vision

Applying some philosophy UX to redesign Vietjet App

Role

Wireframing UI designing

Timeline

Approx. 1 Week

Platform

Mobile

Tools

Desk Research

D·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë∆∞·ª£c tr√≠ch xu·∫•t t·ª´ ‚ÄúNh·∫≠n th·ª©c c·ªßa ng∆∞·ªùi d√¢n v·ªÅ ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông t·ª´ thi·ªán v√† kh·∫£ nƒÉng g√¢y qu·ªπ c·ªßa c√°c t·ªï ch·ª©c phi ch√≠nh ph·ªß Vi·ªát Nam" c·ªßa Vi·ªán nghi√™n c·ª©u x√£ h·ªôi, kinh t·∫ø v√† m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng

User Survey

We surveyed around 52 people from various sectors for understanding what people think about the services and they want.

Typography

As I understand, they try to use their brand typo because they want users remember it. If it is used for promotion banner, it is totally fine.

However, using the typo to highlight crucial information is not a great choice. This typo is quite stylish and it is not easy to read if it is repeated so many times.

Spacing

The current app has 3 main problem:
1) too many choices
2) too much thought required
3) lack of clarity.

Based on Miller's Law, the overloading of information makes users exit out of the app. To reduce cognitive load, my solution is applying 8px spacing to keep user's eyes not tired and makes the design cleaner and spacing more consistent

Booking Process

According to Goal-Gradient Effect, users have the tendency to approach a goal increases with proximity to the goal.

However, the 4 icons without connection make users confused. Users cannot imagine that is a booking process to complete. My solution is creating a line to make a connection and have captions below the icons.

Summary
A bad design makes users distrust the business
